lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton, whose $153 billion takeover offer for a rival mining company, Rio Tinto, was rejected by the target’s board, took its case to shareholders yesterday, detailing what it said would eventually be $3.7 billion in annual savings and holding out the promise of $30 billion in payouts if the deal goes ahead.
